titleproper.value: Guide to the Kentucky Miners Defense Records <num>TAM.032</num>

author.value: Collection processed by Hillel Arnold, 2009; Edited by Maggie Schreiner to include oversize materials, 2013.

publisher.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

addressline: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2018-04-24T13:51:38</date>

corpname.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

abstract.value: The Kentucky Miners Defense was formed to help free miners and local mine union officials convicted of conspiracy to murder three sheriff's deputies in Evarts, Harlan County, Kentucky during the miners' strike of May 1931. The committee was headed by Herbert Mahler, a former official of the Industrial Workers of the World. The collection contains court transcripts, statements and other documents relating to the miners' cases, as well as news releases, United States Senate subcommittee hearing reports, and excerpts from the <emph render="italic">Daily Worker</emph>.

p.value: Identification of item, date; Kentucky Miners Defense Records; TAM 032; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

Donated by Mrs. Herbert Mahler in 1963. The accession number 1963.009 is associated with this gift. One pamphlet (<emph render="italic">Governer Chandler Denies...</emph>) was added to the collection as a donation from the Milwaukee Public Library in 2010.

<list><item>American Civil Liberties Union. <title render="italic">The Kentucky Miners Struggle</title>. (New York: ACLU, 1932).</item><item>Hevener, John. <title render="italic">Which Side Are You on? The Harlan County Coal Miners, 1931-39</title>. Urbana: University of Illinois Press, 1978.</item><item>Publications relating to Kentucky Miners Defense. (Tamiment Library Vertical File).</item></list>

<emph render="bold">Series II, Transcripts, 1931-1933</emph>, contains court transcripts from the cases of Al Benson, Chester Poore, Elzie Phillips, Jim Reynolds and W. B. Jones from Harlan and Montgomery County Circuit Courts.

subject.value: Coal mines and mining |z Kentucky |z Harlan County.
